cyclone.name: JERRY
cyclone.trajectory: turning north Monday then northeast, expected to pass very near Bermuda and continue into the open Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near or just west of Bermuda

weather_observation.impacted_coast: Northern Leeward Islands, Puerto Rico (swells), Bermuda (direct track)
weather_observation.wind: Occasional squally gusts possible well south of the stormâ€™s core, generally below tropical-storm force
weather_observation.rainfall: Brief heavy showers from outer rainbands, totals generally under 2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents on north-facing beaches
